options: The woman is carrying a tray of food.
The woman is wearing a jacket.
The woman is tying up her hair.
The woman is removing her hat.
questions.explanation: The woman is wearing a jacket.

options: Some people are standing next to a filing cabinet.
Some people are searching through a desk.
Some people are watching a presentation.
Some people are looking at a book.
questions.explanation: Some people are looking at a book.

options: A woman is holding a phone up to her ear.
A woman is pouring a beverage into a glass.
Some light fixtures are hanging from the ceiling.
Some tiles are being installed in a hallway.

options: A wooden crate is filled with vegetables.
One of the men is putting vegetables into a shopping bag.
A backpack has been set on the ground.
One of the men is reaching into a bucket.
questions.explanation: A wooden crate is filled with vegetables.

options: Painting supplies have been laid out on the floor.
He's laying a brush down on a windowsill.
He's lifting a can of paint by its handle.
Cans of paint have been placed on a step stool.

options: A path is covered with fallen branches.
A tree is lying across a grassy area.
Some water has pooled on a path.
Some cyclists are riding through a field.
questions.explanation: Some water has pooled on a path.

questions.questionText: Where is the conference being held?
questions.explanation: At the Riverview Hotel.

questions.questionText: When does the warehouse manager arrive?
questions.explanation: Not until this afternoon.

questions.questionText: There's a nice park nearby, right?
options: Did you order paper for the copier?
questions.explanation: Yes-it's next to Greendale Lake.

questions.questionText: Who sent the meeting minutes to the accounting department?
questions.explanation: Our office assistant.

questions.questionText: I'd like to know what you think of our new finance analyst.
options: I've prepared the decorations for tomorrow.
questions.explanation: He seems very competent.

questions.questionText: Let's go on the company retreat.
options: He tried to solve that problem.
questions.explanation: Yes, that's a good idea.

questions.questionText: What time can I pick up my glasses?
questions.explanation: We close at six o'clock.

questions.questionText: The sales team knows how to use the tracking software, don't they?
options: I haven't seen them using it yet.
questions.explanation: I haven't seen them using it yet.

questions.questionText: Are you going to the hardware store on Mill Street?
options: The blue package you sent me.
questions.explanation: That store hasn't opened yet.

questions.questionText: Would you be able to write the introduction for the workshop?
questions.explanation: OK, I'd be happy to.

questions.questionText: I picked up some flowers for Tunji's retirement party.
questions.explanation: That was thoughtful.

questions.questionText: Which meeting room did you tell the interns to go to?
questions.explanation: The Jefferson Room.

questions.questionText: Is your dental appointment next Tuesday?
options: I'll have to check my calendar.
Yes, it was a good meeting.
questions.explanation: I'll have to check my calendar.

questions.questionText: Why aren't there any brochures in the lobby?
options: No, I haven't received my confirmation e-mail yet.
Because someone just took the last one.
questions.explanation: Because someone just took the last one.

questions.questionText: What's the process for submitting my expense report?
options: You send it to the finance department.
questions.explanation: You send it to the finance department.

questions.questionText: Do you sell your products online or in stores?
questions.explanation: Only online.

questions.questionText: How often do you charge this device?
questions.explanation: Whenever the light turns red.

questions.questionText: The tickets to Friday night's concert cost ten dollars each.
options: No, I can't play the guitar.
questions.explanation: Actually, they're fifteen.

questions.questionText: Can't you update the database today?
questions.explanation: I did it yesterday.

questions.questionText: How are we going to fit the extra supplies in that closet?
options: It's the door at the end of the hallway.
questions.explanation: Natalie's in charge of supplies.

questions.questionText: Have all the new windows been installed?
options: The construction crew is almost finished.
This isn't the tallest ladder available.
questions.explanation: The construction crew is almost finished.

questions.questionText: Would you rather go to lunch now or at noon?
options: I'm taking a client to lunch.
On the corner of Fourth and Main.
The daily special is soup and a sandwich.
questions.explanation: I'm taking a client to lunch.

questions.questionText: You're taking the training in the afternoon, aren't you?
options: The new head of the accounting department.
No, I take my coffee black.
Well, it depends on my schedule.
questions.explanation: Well, it depends on my schedule.

questions.questionText: Shouldn't Ms. Ishida look over the financial projections?
options: I'm meeting with her at ten.
questions.explanation: I'm meeting with her at ten.

questions.questionText: When are you going to choose a new project manager?
questions.explanation: I'm really busy this week.

questions.audioTranscript:
M Hi. I'm calling to book three tickets for this Thursday's tennis match. Are there any seats left?
W Just a few! Tickets for Thursday's match have been selling quickly.
M I'm not surprised! After all, Ife Rotimi won the regional championship tournament last month. Everyone wants to see her play after her incredible performance. What seats are available?
W Well, there's only one group of three seats together. Advance payment is required to hold them.
questions.questionText: What type of food product does the speakers' company sell?
questions.explanation: The speakers discuss cheese products.

questions.questionText: What does the man suggest?
questions.explanation: The man suggests offering additional options.

questions.questionText: What does the woman say she will do?
questions.explanation: The woman says she will contact a production manager.

questions.audioTranscript:
M Hi. I'm calling to book three tickets for this Thursday's tennis match. Are there any seats left?
W Just a few! Tickets for Thursday's match have been selling quickly.
M I'm not surprised! After all, Ife Rotimi won the regional championship tournament last month. Everyone wants to see her play after her incredible performance. What seats are available?
W Well, there's only one group of three seats together. Advance payment is required to hold them.
questions.questionText: Why is the man calling?
options: To buy tickets to an event
questions.explanation: The man says he is calling to book three tickets for a tennis match.

questions.questionText: What did Ife Rotimi do last month?
questions.explanation: The man mentions that Ife Rotimi won the regional championship tournament last month.

questions.questionText: What does the woman say is required?
questions.explanation: The woman states that advance payment is required to hold the seats.

questions.audioTranscript:
W Thanks for agreeing to help me organize the library's annual fund-raising dinner, Klaus. We hope the event brings in enough money to expand our children's book section.
M What task would you like me to start with?
W Well, I could use some help sending out the invitations.
M OK, I can take care of that. Is there a list of attendees available?
W It's in my computer files. I'll e-mail it to you.
questions.questionText: What event are the speakers planning?
questions.explanation: The woman mentions organizing the library's annual fund-raising dinner.

questions.questionText: What task does the woman ask the man to help with?
questions.explanation: The woman asks the man to help send out the invitations.

questions.questionText: What does the woman say she will do?
questions.explanation: The woman says she will e-mail the list of attendees.

questions.audioTranscript:
W Hey, Brian and Matteo. I found some great pens to give away at the community festival to promote our business.
M1 Great. Can we put our cleaning service logo on them?
W Yes, for no extra charge. And they're biodegradable. They're made from paper.
M2 So when we hand them out, we can mention that.
M1 As well as talk about the organic cleaning supplies our company uses.
W OK. I'll go ahead and order several cases.
questions.questionText: What event are the speakers preparing for?
questions.explanation: The woman says the pens will be given away at a community festival.

questions.questionText: What is mentioned about some pens?
options: They are available in multiple colors.
They are preferred by book authors.
questions.explanation: The woman mentions that the pens are biodegradable and made from paper.

questions.questionText: What does the woman offer to do?
questions.explanation: The woman says she will order several cases of pens.

questions.audioTranscript:
W Jamestown Recycling Facility. How can I help you?
M Hi. I'm preparing to move soon, and I have some electronics, such as televisions and computers, that I'd like to get rid of before I put my house on the market.
W Yes, that's right. We'll take all electronics.
M Great. Do you provide a pickup service?
W No, unfortunately you'll have to bring everything here yourself. However, on our Web site we list a number of companies that can remove and dispose of the items for you.
questions.questionText: Where does the woman work?
questions.explanation: The woman answers the phone as a representative of a recycling facility.

questions.questionText: What does the man want to dispose of?
questions.explanation: The man says he wants to get rid of televisions and computers.

questions.questionText: What does the woman say can be found on a Web site?
questions.explanation: The woman mentions a list of companies on the Web site.

questions.audioTranscript:
M Zaina! What a surprise! I haven't seen you since we took that class for business owners together last year.
W Great, thanks. I was just in the neighborhood and thought I'd stop in for a cookie or a piece of cake.
M Thank you! It's been a good year for business.
W Really? Well, I noticed that Sunnyvale Restaurant went out of business, and the building's up for lease. It's very close to the local university.
questions.questionText: How do the speakers know each other?
options: They used to work for the same company.
They grew up in the same neighborhood.
questions.explanation: The man says they took a class for business owners together.

questions.questionText: What type of business does the man most likely own?
questions.explanation: The woman mentions cookies, cake, and baked goods, indicating the man owns a bakery.

questions.questionText: What advantage does the woman point out about a rental space?
questions.explanation: The woman says the rental space is very close to the local university.

questions.audioTranscript:
W Hi, Koji. I think our new video game is nearly ready to be released. Are you aware of any improvements that need to be made before then?
M Actually, I just finished testing the game this morning. I found a problem in the third stage of the game. There were a few times when my character couldn't move.
W Oh, that's strange!
M I double-checked the problem using a different controller. The same issue came up.
W Oh. I think Pauline had a similar problem with a game she tested. Maybe you should ask her about it.
questions.questionText: Who most likely are the speakers?
questions.explanation: They discuss testing and fixing a video game before release.

questions.questionText: What did the man recently do?
questions.explanation: The man says he finished testing the game this morning.

questions.questionText: What does the woman suggest?
questions.explanation: She suggests asking Pauline, who had a similar problem.

questions.audioTranscript:
M You've reached the maintenance office at Hillview Apartment Complex.
W Hi. This is Palavi Sen from unit 35B. I'm calling because the new thermostat in my apartment isn't working. It keeps shutting off and turning on randomly.
M When did this issue start?
W A few hours ago. The thermostat was just installed yesterday.
M OK. I can come and take a look at it tomorrow morning.
W But it's supposed to be below freezing tonight!
questions.questionText: Who most likely is the man?
questions.explanation: The man answers the phone at a maintenance office.

questions.questionText: What problem does the woman describe?
questions.explanation: She says the thermostat keeps shutting off and turning on.

questions.questionText: What does the woman mean when she says, "it's supposed to be below freezing tonight"?
options: She is surprised by the weather forecast.
She wants a service to be completed sooner.
She will move some items indoors.
She would prefer to park near her apartment.
questions.explanation: She wants the problem fixed sooner because of the cold weather.

questions.audioTranscript:
M Many of our factory workers have expressed interest in upgrading their skills. I'd like to implement a peer-training program.
W I'm afraid that might become a burden for our long-time employees. They'll have to slow down their work.
M What if we videotaped experienced employees doing specific tasks? High-quality video can be recorded and edited with a smartphone.
W I like that idea. It would allow us to capture expertise without slowing down the production line.
questions.questionText: What does the man want to do?
questions.explanation: The man wants to implement a training program for workers.

questions.questionText: What is the woman concerned about?
questions.explanation: She worries experienced employees will have to slow down their work.

questions.questionText: What does the man mean when he says, "High-quality video can be recorded and edited with a smartphone"?
options: A new policy should be established.
An idea is easy to implement.
questions.explanation: He means the idea is practical and easy to carry out.

questions.audioTranscript:
W Hi, Suresh. I'm at the airport waiting for my flight. I want to meet with a potential investor while I'm in Chicago. Her name's Marta Gomez.
M OK. Which day would you prefer to meet with her?
W How about right after my meeting with the Chicago staff?
M OK. By the way, did you see that our company won an award for our contributions to the community?
questions.questionText: Where is the woman?
questions.explanation: The woman says she is at the airport waiting for her flight.

questions.questionText: When does the woman prefer to meet with an investor?
questions.explanation: She says she wants to meet right after her meeting with the Chicago staff, which is shown on the graphic as Wednesday.

questions.questionText: What good news does the man share?
options: An airline ticket has been upgraded.
questions.explanation: The man says their company won an award for community contributions.

questions.audioTranscript:
M Marion, we keep getting calls from people who want to visit the botanical garden but can't find parking information.
W It is on our Web site, but it's at the bottom of the About Us page.
M I think we should move that information and make a separate page for directions and parking.
W I'd be happy to make that change, but we're updating our software, so it will have to wait until Monday.
questions.questionText: Where do the speakers work?
questions.explanation: They talk about visitors to a botanical garden.

questions.questionText: Which page on the Web site does the man want to change?
questions.explanation: He wants to move information currently on the About Us page, shown as Page 2 in the graphic.

questions.questionText: Why does the woman say she cannot complete a task until Monday?
options: She requires approval from a manager.
Some clients will be arriving soon.
questions.explanation: She says the software is being updated.

questions.audioTranscript:
M Good news! We have finally received approval for our project to install bicycle racks at the train station downtown.
W Great! Now we need to decide where to place them.
M I think riders would prefer racks close to the platform.
W Let's do that. I'll contact some companies for estimates.
questions.questionText: What news does the man share?
options: A station road will be closed for repair.
A parking area has been expanded.
questions.explanation: The man says the project has been approved.

questions.questionText: Where do the speakers decide to install some bicycle racks?
questions.explanation: They decide on the location closest to the platform, shown as the short-term parking area.

questions.questionText: Why does the woman say she will contact some companies?
questions.explanation: She says she will contact companies for cost estimates.

questions.questionText: The lecture will take place at 6:00 P.M., ----- which attendees may ask questions.
questions.explanation: After is the correct preposition indicating the time sequence.

questions.questionText: The ------- antique shop in Pepper Valley will close down next month.
questions.explanation: Last is the correct adjective form meaning 'remaining'.

questions.questionText: Merryville residents will receive an online status ------- about the ongoing bridge construction project.
questions.explanation: Update is the appropriate noun for status information.

questions.questionText: As a result of ------- many years leading media organizations, Ms. Ayo was selected for the Dowel Journalism Prize.
questions.explanation: Her is the correct possessive pronoun before the gerund phrase.

questions.questionText: To stop the ------- of computer viruses, do not open suspicious e-mails.
questions.explanation: Spread is the correct noun referring to the transmission of viruses.

questions.questionText: The hiring manager ------- considered each applicant's résumé and qualifications.
questions.explanation: Carefully is the correct adverb modifying the verb 'considered'.

questions.questionText: In October, Mr. Sakamoto will leave for New Zealand ------- will oversee the opening of the new Auckland branch.
questions.explanation: And is the correct conjunction connecting two clauses about what Mr. Sakamoto will do.

questions.questionText: Tarateer Pharmaceuticals is varying its product ------- to include over-the-counter medications.
questions.explanation: Line is the correct noun form referring to 'product line'.

questions.questionText: Dynart, Inc., continuously ------- new ways to reduce its use of plastics.
questions.explanation: Seeks is the correct present tense verb form for the subject 'Dynart, Inc.'.

questions.questionText: The cash registers at Pirkle Books automatically ------- the remaining inventory of books available.
questions.explanation: Calculate is the correct verb form following the adverb 'automatically'.

questions.questionText: The product team is designing mapping software that can ------- locate underground minerals.
questions.explanation: Precisely is the correct adverb for accurately locating something.

questions.questionText: According to CEO Mayu Yamada, it would not be ------- responsible to expand the warehouse at this time.
questions.explanation: Financially is the correct adverb modifying the adjective 'responsible'.

questions.questionText: Analysts cannot say with any ------- what the regional demand for electric trucks will be.
questions.explanation: Certainty is the correct noun that fits the context of expressing confidence in predictions.

questions.questionText: As part of its marketing campaign, Elegancia Dishware is ------- soliciting feedback from customers.
questions.explanation: Actively is the correct adverb describing how they are soliciting feedback.

questions.questionText: Rain gardens are intended to ------- water to prevent flooding of local roads.
questions.explanation: Absorb is the correct verb describing how rain gardens function with water.

questions.questionText: Theta Industries' training program aims to increase the ------- of its manufacturing systems.
questions.explanation: Productive is the correct adjective form.

questions.questionText: The board of directors has voted to award Mr. Mitrakos a bonus for his role ------- obtaining the international contract.
questions.explanation: In is the correct preposition for 'role in obtaining'.

questions.questionText: The finance director gave his approval ------- the project can move forward.
questions.explanation: So that is the correct conjunction showing purpose.

questions.questionText: The newspaper article describes ways job seekers can ------- for having little workplace experience.
questions.explanation: Compensate is the correct verb meaning to make up for a deficiency.

questions.questionText: Mr. Ellis and Ms. Barnes were both highly qualified, but ------- got the job.
questions.explanation: Myself is the correct pronoun in this context.

questions.questionText: Ennis Photography purchased all new lighting equipment ------- the high cost.
questions.explanation: Despite is the correct preposition showing contrast.

questions.questionText: Marburton residents who wish to ------- a home should contact the award-winning team at Kwan Real Estate.
questions.explanation: Sell is the correct infinitive verb form after 'wish to'.

questions.questionText: Maswa Bistro began a ------- agreement with local farmers to purchase a set amount of produce each week.
questions.explanation: Cooperative is the correct adjective describing a mutually beneficial agreement.

questions.questionText: The City of Doyle's new downtown parking ------- have been met with opposition by residents and visitors.
questions.explanation: Restrictions is the correct noun form as the subject of the sentence.

questions.questionText: The plumbing position requires extensive training, even for those who studied ------- in technical school.
questions.explanation: Diligently is the correct adverb describing how they studied.

questions.questionText: With its fixed price -------, Omega Cellular guarantees no phone bill increases for three years.
questions.explanation: Assurance is the correct noun meaning a guarantee or promise.

questions.questionText: As chief analytics officer, Mr. Ko has worked at Lochston Ltd. with great ------- for more than twenty years.
questions.explanation: Dedication is the correct noun meaning commitment and loyalty.

questions.questionText: Milltown Hospital's cafeteria serves lunch seven days a week ------- only on weekdays.
questions.explanation: Rather than is the correct phrase showing contrast between seven days vs weekdays only.

questions.questionText: The store's entire inventory of lumber comes from a nearby ------- supplier.
questions.explanation: Commercial is the correct adjective describing a business supplier.

questions.questionText: For a $95 fee, our mechanics will ------- determine what repairs are needed.
questions.explanation: Diagnostic is the correct adjective modifying the process of determining repairs.
